How to apply to the University of Victoria

  • Choose a program of your choice
  • Submit your admission application
  • Submit your interim grades
  • Accept your admission offer

Please note that to apply for Victoria’s admission one of the requirement is the English language proficiency test with is proficiency tests

English language requirement

All applicants have to exhibit English language proficiency to focus on the University of Victoria.    You might have already met this requirement if you studied full-time for at least four years within Canada in an educational curriculum at the high school or post-secondary level for at least four years, and all of your lessons were in English.

If you need to exhibit proof of language proficiency, you can do so through academic studies, English language proficiency tests, or programs offered by UVic’s English Language Centre.

After you have applied to UVic, your language proficiency time limit will indicate in your online submission checklist

English language proficiency tests

English language proficiency can be verified by submitting satisfactory scores from CAEL, IELTS, LPI, MELAB, or TOEFL tests.

  • All test scores must be sent directly to the UVic from the testing organization.
  • We will not accept unauthorized test scores.
  • We will not accept tests taken more than two years before your application to UVic.
  • Additional tests may be considered on an individual basis subsequent to an analysis by Undergraduate Admissions to determine if test scores are similar to the level required for the TOEFL.
  •  Any candidate applying for entry in summer 2024, September 2024, or January 2024, will accept scores from the online tests offered by CAEL, IELTS, and TOEFL.

The English language proficiency tests minimum scores are as follows:

                 Tests    Minimum Scores
CAEL               70 with no section less than 60 IELTS               6.5, with no component less than 6.0
LPI                    Level 6 MELAB             90
TOFEF IBT     (internet-based test)*       90, with no section less than 20 TOFEL PBT   (paper-based test*                       575

The UVic’s TOEFL institution code is 0989
